citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
During inspection, a deceased budgerigar was discovered in the back avian holding. During investigation it was noted that
the written program of veterinary care does not provide guidance for the avian species. The written program of veterinary
care must be updated to ensure adequate veterinary guidance for all regulated species.
Correct by November 07, 2023

In the enclosure housing 5 cattle and 3 zebu the rear gate in the shelter has lost boards due to rot. The loss of the board
resulted in 6 exposed screws and fencing points that could injure the animals The enclosure housing facilities shall be
structurally sound and maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals. The screws
and sharp fence points need to be removed or repaired so no sharp points are sticking out into the enclosure.
Correct by November 14, 2023

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection the facility's environmental enhancement plan for birds did not include the domestic goose,
domestic duck, Chilean flamingo, American flamingo, great-horned owl, and laughing kookaburra. The facility needs to
include all avian specie in their plan for environmental enhancement for psychological well-being of birds under the
direction of their attending veterinarian.
Correct by November 14, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
KRISTIN NAPOLI, SUPERVISORY ANIMAL CARE SPECIALIST
Christopher Scott, Program Analyst
Ashok Anant
Melissa Cavazos n

narrative:
2.40(b)(4)  Critical
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
During inspection, a deceased budgerigar was discovered in the back avian holding. During investigation it was noted that 
the written program of veterinary care does not provide guidance for the avian species. The written program of veterinary 
care must be updated to ensure adequate veterinary guidance for all regulated species. 
Correct by November 07, 2023 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
In the enclosure housing 5 cattle and 3 zebu the rear gate in the shelter has lost boards due to rot. The loss of the board 
resulted in 6 exposed screws and fencing points that could injure the animals The enclosure housing facilities shall be 
structurally sound and maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals. The screws 
and sharp fence points need to be removed or repaired so no sharp points are sticking out into the enclosure.  
Correct by November 14, 2023 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
At the time of inspection the facility's environmental enhancement plan for birds did not include the domestic goose, 
domestic duck, Chilean flamingo, American flamingo, great-horned owl, and laughing kookaburra. The facility needs to 
include all avian specie in their plan for environmental enhancement for psychological well-being of birds under the 
direction of their attending veterinarian. 
Correct by November 14, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.

Additional Inspectors:

Christopher Scott, Program Analyst 
Ashok Anant 
Melissa Cavazos n
